name: Lemon Lime & Bitters Thai Chicken￼
description: Angostura’s secret blend of botanicals and slight sweetness turns a classic jerk chicken into the ultimate spicy, salty, citrussy and floral grilled chicken, but – you know me – with a Thai twist. Pair these succulent chicken pieces and their lip-smackingly sticky glaze with fresh leaves and rice, then tuck into the perfect weekend entertainer.
keywords: Barbecue, Best-ever chicken recipes, Chicken, Chicken wings, Dinner, Dinner Party, Drumsticks, Easter, Eat with your hands, Grill, How-to, Make ahead meals, Picnic, Roasts, Weekend meals
recipeIngredient: 4 x chicken Marylands, cut in half to form 8 pieces
1 lime (you’ll need the zest and the juice)
1 lemon (you’ll need the zest and the juice)

recipeInstructions.text: 1.Place the chicken pieces on a large tray lined with paper towels. Season generously with sea salt all over, then allow the chicken pieces to sit for 5 minutes to help draw out the excess moisture, then wipe off with paper towel.

2.Meanwhile, to make the lemon lime & bitters marinade, place all the ingredients into the bowl of a food processor. Blitz to a super-fine paste. Transfer the marinade to a large bowl, then add the chicken. Give everything a good mix to ensure the chicken pieces are coated all over, then cover the bowl with cling film and refrigerate overnight.

3.The next day, preheat oven to 190°C fan-forced (370°F). Line a baking tray with baking paper and place an ovenproof cooking rack on top of the lined tray. Arrange chicken pieces on top of the rack. Cook chicken in the oven for 30 minutes or until golden in colour.

4.In the meantime, pour the leftover marinade into a small saucepan and place over low heat. Add the sugar. Bring to a gentle simmer, then cook for 5 minutes until the mixture has a sticky jam consistency. Remove from the heat and set aside for later.

5.Remove the chicken from the oven and drizzle each piece with a little of the chilli jam mixture. Return the tray to the oven and cook for a further 5–10 minutes or until the pieces are looking lovely and caramelised.
6.Serve while warm with sticky rice, baby cos and extra chilli jam on the side.
